controller

Class PVEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.GameController
      • controller.PVEnvironment

  • public class PVEnvironment
extends GameController
    This controller will be used for managing the Player versus environment mode.
    Author:
    GROUP 22

      • PVEnvironment

        public PVEnvironment()

    • Method Detail

      • initializeGame

        public static void initializeGame(java.lang.String player1name,
                                  int toLevel)
        If you are initializing a Player Versus Environment session, call this method to setup the game for the first time. (To initialize a Player v Player session, call the same method in the PvPController instead; do not use the one in GameController).
        Parameters:
        player1name - is a string value that represents the username for player 1

      • playMoveAt

        public static void playMoveAt(int x,
                              int y)
        The GUI should call this method to play the move requested by the user. then it will prompt the environment to make a move immediately afterwards based on the level setting the user selected for this PVE session.
        Parameters:
        x - is the (n)th row (starting at 0) of the selected square the user requested to place the piece on.
        y - is the (n)th column (starting at 0) of the selected square the user requested to place the piece on.

      • environmentPlayTurn

        public static void environmentPlayTurn()
        This private method will determine which method will be executed to play a move based on the level selected. This method acts like a switch board.

      • playAnOtherRound

        public static void playAnOtherRound()

      • getPlayerMoves

        public static java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getPlayerMoves()
        Get the history of each move the user has made.
        Returns:
        the playerMoves

      • addPlayerMoves

        public static void addPlayerMoves(int x,
                                  int y)
        Once the player's move is successful, add the x and y coordinates to the list.
        Parameters:
        playerMoves - the playerMoves to set

      • getPlayersLastMove

        public static int[] getPlayersLastMove()
